permissions.name: Manage Locations
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's locations.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the location to archive.

docs.summary:
Archives a location.

> **Notes:**
> + Changes the `archived` boolean of a location to `true`.
> + You can't change a location's `status` using this endpoint.
> + Archived locations can't be updated.
> + Currently, it isn't possible to unarchive locations.
> + The `default` location can't be archived.

docs.summary:
Replaces a location.

> **Note:** Currently, it isn't possible to partially update a location. Therefore, you'll need to pass the full location object in the body of the call.

examples.title: Update Location

members.name: path
members.doc:
Identifies which part of the FileDescriptorProto was defined at this
 location.

 Each element is a field number or an index.  They form a path from
 the root FileDescriptorProto to the place where the definition.  For
 example, this path:
   [ 4, 3, 2, 7, 1 ]
 refers to:
   file.message_type(3)  // 4, 3
       .field(7)         // 2, 7
       .name()           // 1
 This is because FileDescriptorProto.message_type has field number 4:
   repeated DescriptorProto message_type = 4;
 and DescriptorProto.field has field number 2:
   repeated FieldDescriptorProto field = 2;
 and FieldDescriptorProto.name has field number 1:
   optional string name = 1;

 Thus, the above path gives the location of a field name.  If we removed
 the last element:
   [ 4, 3, 2, 7 ]
 this path refers to the whole field declaration (from the beginning
 of the label to the terminating semicolon).

members.name: span
members.doc:
Always has exactly three or four elements: start line, start column,
 end line (optional, otherwise assumed same as start line), end column.
 These are packed into a single field for efficiency.  Note that line
 and column numbers are zero-based -- typically you will want to add
 1 to each before displaying to a user.

members.name: leadingComments

docs.summary:
Time periods that this location is open for business. Includes a collection of TimePeriod instances.
Aligned with https://developers.google.com/my-business/reference/rest/v4/accounts.locations#businesshours
With a few minor adjustments

members.name: periods
members.doc:
Times that this location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours.

docs.summary:
A span of time that the business is open,
starting on the specified open day/time and closing on the specified close day/time.
Closing time must occur after the opening time, for example later in the same day, or on a subsequent day.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

docs.summary: Set of time periods when a location's operational hours differ from its normal business hours.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: endDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this is the default location. There can only be one default location per site. The default location can't be archived.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Location status. Defaults to `ACTIVE`. 
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/archive-location) 
doesn't affect the location's status. `INACTIVE` is currently not supported.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Business schedule. Array of weekly recurring time periods when the location is open for business. Limited to 100 time periods.

__Note:__ Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the location is updated. 
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a location.

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Whether the location is archived. Archived locations can't be updated. 
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/archive-location) 
doesn't affect its `status`.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Extra information that helps finding the location.

docs.summary: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude of the location. Must be between -90 and 90.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude of the location. Must be between -180 and 180.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:  
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
 If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
 If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the location to retrieve.

members.name: paging
members.doc: [Pagination](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/crm/contacts/pagination), defaults to offset = 0 and limit = 50 (max limit 1,000).

members.name: includeArchived
members.doc: Whether to include `archived` locations in the response. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: query
members.doc: Information about the filters, sorting, and paging.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the location to set as default.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the location to archive.

docs.summary:
Enumerates the days of the week. Possible values are:
  • MONDAY
  • TUESDAY
  • WEDNESDAY
  • THURSDAY
  • FRIDAY
  • SATURDAY
  • SUNDAY

For future use Possible values are:
  • ACTIVE
  • INACTIVE

For future use Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • BRANCH
  • OFFICES
  • RECEPTION
  • HEADQUARTERS

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.
